Greetings to Secretary General of C.C., Communist Party of Vietnam 
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- The Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea on Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Nong Duc Manh upon his reelection as secretary general of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam.
 The message noted that his reelection is an expression of deep trust of all the members of the Communist Party of Vietnam and the Vietnamese people in him.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two parties would develop as desired by the peoples of the two countries, the message wished the secretary general great success in his responsible work for the strengthening and development of the Party and the implementation of the decision of the 10th Party Congress.

Iranians Mark KPA Birthday 
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Jalaleddin Namini Mianji hosted a reception at the embassy here on Wednesday to mark the 74th birthday of the heroic Korean People's Army.
 Present there on invitation were general officers and officers of the KPA.
 On hand were staff members of the Iranian embassy.    
 Speeches were made at the reception.

Efforts Directed to Preserve Cultural Remains
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- April and November every year have been set as months for preserving cultural remains in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
 In this April the management offices for cultural remains across the country are striving to manage and preserve well the historical relics and remains associated with wisdom and talent of the nation.    
 In Pyongyang city, efforts are being exerted to keep a lot of historical relics in the area of Mt. Taesong and other parts of the city including the mausoleums of King Tangun and King Tongmyong in their origin and to arrange their surroundings well.
 People in South and North Hwanghae Provinces are taking good care of the Samsong Temple in Mt. Kuwol, ancient tomb No.3 in Anak, fort in Mt. Jongbang, Songbul Temple and other historical relics and have built cultural recreation grounds for visitors.
 Over 20 historical relics are being repaired and arranged in North Hamgyong Province. And Kaesong City has repaired roofs of more than 30 buildings and forts, heaped earth over tens of old mounds and repainted structures colorfully.    
 The management and preservation institutions for cultural remains throughout the country are taking measures to guide the mass campaign in a technical way.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Marked
articles.content:
Pyongyang Middle School No.1
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- Twenty two years have elapsed since Kim Jong Il gave on-the-spot guidance to Pyongyang Middle School No. 1 on April 28, Juche 73 (1984) in spite of the rain.
 That day he acquainted himself with the school affairs in detail and convened a consultative meeting of leading officials in the field of education to deliver a historic speech on reinforcing the school.    
 He, in the speech, set forth concrete tasks and ways to convert the school into a center for training talents. He clarified how to form the education contents, work out teaching program, raise teachers' quality and to arrange educational environment.
 Under his wise guidance, the school has turned into a center for training talents provided with the highest level of educational conditions as he taught.
 The school, with a total floor space of over 28,000 square meters, is furnished with several hundred kinds of modern educational facilities and fittings and several thousand pieces of experimental apparatuses of more than 400 kinds. And it has various sorts of nearly 20 laboratories, a music room, a gymnasium, a swimming-pool and a library commensurate with the high level of education.    
 Over the last two decades, the school has consistently introduced advanced educational contents and method for training talents into teaching and produced a lot of talents who are in charge of scientific and technical development of the country.
 Among them are program developers who gained three consecutive victories in international computer paduk(go) championships, doctors and scientists in their twenties in the fields of mathematics, physics and life science and hundreds of personnel with academic degrees and titles.

Message of Sympathy to Egyptian President
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly Kim Yong Nam sent a message of sympathy to Egyptian President Mohamed Hosni Mubarak on Thursday.
 Upon hearing the news that a recent bomb explosion in Egypt caused considerable human casualties, Kim Yong Nam in the message expressed deep sympathy to the president and, through him, to the Egyptian government and the bereaved families.

DPRK Weightlifters Prove Successful at Asian Weightlifting Championships
    Pyongyang, April 27 (KCNA) -- DPRK players won 19 gold medals and three silver medals at the 7th Asian Adult Club Weightlifting Championships held in Tashkent of Uzbekistan from April 20 to 23.
 The championships drew at least 80 men and women weightlifters from 12 Asian countries and regions.
